summary: This is a formal request for mutual legal assistance from the Paris Public Prosecutor's Office to U.S. authorities, dated July 8, 2020. It outlines a French investigation into Jean-Luc Brunel and others in connection with the Epstein case, detailing allegations of sexual assault, rape, and participation in a criminal association. The request seeks U.S. investigative materials related to Brunel, Ghislaine Maxwell, and French victims.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.role: Director of model agency Karin Models, accused
persons.context: French modeling agency director accused of sexually assaulting and raping models, described as a close friend of Jeffrey Epstein who allegedly provided him with young girls from his agency.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused, central figure in the case
persons.context: Suspected of sexually exploiting dozens of young girls and setting up a network; his arrest, charges, and death in custody are mentioned. His Paris residence was searched.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's partner who allegedly organized the arrival and stay of victims at his residences. She was arrested in the U.S. on July 2, 2020.

persons.name: Aude Groualle
persons.role: Vice-Prosecutor, Head of the Paris Public Prosecutor's Office for Minors
persons.context: Magistrate who issued the request for mutual legal assistance.

persons.name: Barthelemy Hennuyer
persons.role: Substitute, Minors' Section of the Paris Public Prosecutor's Office
persons.context: Substitute prosecutor who signed the request on behalf of the Public Prosecutor.

persons.name: Arindam Bhattacharya
persons.context: Certified the English translation of the document.

connections.description: Described as close friends; Brunel allegedly provided Epstein with young girls from his modeling agency's pool.
Described as Epstein's partner who allegedly organized the logistics for victims at his residences.
Both are named as part of the network benefiting from and facilitating Epstein's activities.

events.title: French preliminary investigation initiated
events.description: The Minors' Section of the Paris Public Prosecutor's Office initiated a preliminary investigation into charges of rape, sexual assault, and participation in a criminal association related to Jeffrey Epstein and his possible accomplices, concerning French victims.

events.title: Initial report from 'Innocence en danger'
events.description: The Public Prosecutor's Office received a report from the association 'Innocence en danger' stating France was concerned due to French nationals being involved and that French victims existed.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Paris residence
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's Paris residence at 22 Avenue Foch was searched, resulting in the seizure of computers, storage media, documents, and photographs of young women.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on American soil.

events.title: Arrest and death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Upon his return from a stay in Paris, Jeffrey Epstein was arrested, charged, detained in Manhattan, and later found dead in his cell.

locations: 22 Avenue Foch, Paris 16th district (Jeffrey Epstein's Paris residence)
Avenue Roche, Paris (Jean-Luc Brunel's Parisian home)
keyFacts: The French investigation was initiated on August 23, 2019, focusing on rape, sexual assault, and participation in a criminal association involving Jeffrey Epstein, Jean-Luc Brunel, and Ghislaine Maxwell, concerning French victims.
Jean-Luc Brunel, a French modeling agency director, is accused of sexually assaulting and raping models, and is alleged to have provided young girls from his agency to Jeffrey Epstein.
A search of Epstein's Paris apartment at 22 Avenue Foch in September 2019 yielded computers containing numerous photographs and videos of young, partially or totally undressed girls, and documents.
The document references multiple testimonies from women alleging sexual assaults by Brunel and Epstein, with some accounts describing being drugged and raped.

This is a formal, confidential request from French authorities to U.S. authorities for all investigative materials related to Brunel, Maxwell, and French victims, demonstrating active international cooperation in the case.
